result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan L. Cavins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing Hearing 9/17/18

Defendant Ryan L. Cavins in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Ryan L. Cavins in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 1, 2 & 3:

WI State Prison for 5 years (3 years Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision), consecutive to any other but concurrent to each other

Conditions of extended supervision:
580 days jail credit
Repayment of any unpaid court obligations
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.  Must notify agent of any new prescriptions within 24 hours
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Paperwork handed in court.
NOH for Sentencing Hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 17, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 17, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan L. Cavins in court in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases. Attorneys state appearances. No corrections. 3 seperate accounts for probation in 2014 agreed by all parties. Joint recommendation. State makes statement on global resolution.  Asks Court to adopt.  Atty Masana makes statement.  Time of 4yr initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision and 2 additional probation periods will be best resolution.  Asks court to adopt.  Court addresses issue of DE not being eligible for release programs due to charge and time being served.  Atty Masana uncomfortable.  Challenge incarceration program would be unavailable per Court.  Court prepared to proceed with sent after revocation and leave other matters or reset entire matter. Atty Masana prefers to reschedule.  


3 counts run concurrent to these matters 
 


Restitution stipul returned/  victim impact stmt returned   post conviction matters returned. 






18cf295  Plea of no contest as repeater
Defendant Ryan L. Cavins in court in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases. Attorneys state appearances. No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Victim requirements met in all matters.

efendant Ryan L. Cavins in court in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases. Attorneys state appearances. No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty to amended count.  Victim impact statement provided. 18cm325   Plea as repeater:
No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court. Court states complaint does not refer to repeater and wondering if amended complaint is to be filed.  Oral motion to amend by State to conform with agreement. Atty Masana agrees. Court finds Defendant guilty. Victim impact statement provided.  Restitution information provided by the State

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan L. Cavins in court with attorney Peter M Masana.  Defendant Ryan L. Cavins in custody.  John A Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states recommendation.  Atty Masana agrees and NC pleas entered to counts 1-3.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE will waive his right to a PSI.  Atty Masana state DE will waive right to PSI.  Court questions DE/accepts waiver of PSI.  State makes statement.  Atty Masana makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Cts 1, 2 and 3:  NC
Probation for 5 years on each concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
12 months jail on Ct 1 only w/huber privileges to commence forthwith
Costs of $268.00 x 3 to be paid during term of probation
$250.00 x 3 DNA surcharge and sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment per agent
Random urinalysis
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances at all times
Not to go to taverns/liquor stores or any business where drug paraphernalia is sold
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or education or a combination thereof
Not to associate w/people consuming drugs and/or alcohol
No contact w/M.O., C.M. or J.O. (co-actors)
Criminal Thinking treatment/counseling
Treatment/any other conditions per agent
87 days jail credit if probation is revoked
Cts 4 and 5:  Dismissed/read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Jury trial on September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continued.  20 days to file motions w/Br 3.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2014 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Ryan L. Cavins appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet qualifed for public defender.  State request $5,000 cash bond w/ no contact provisions.  Defendant does not have an adult criminal record.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Defendant is not employed.  Address on complaint is correct.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $3,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/ M.O., J.O, J.C, and T.H.  May not go upon premises at 426 Monroe Street, Sauk City WI.  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  Use in accordance with that Rx.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 11:45 am.
